title: 111_hr1730
content: The "Vehicles for the Future Act" is also known as the Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Act. The "Vehicles for the Future Act" or Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Act amends the Public Utility Regulatory Policies Act to require electric utilities to develop plans for supporting plug-in hybrid electric vehicles and electric vehicle infrastructure, including charging stations in various locations. The Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Act mandates State plans for supporting plug-in hybrid electric vehicles and electric vehicle infrastructure, including charging stations. Each plan must deploy necessary infrastructure to support these vehicles. State regulatory authorities are required to support electric utilities in meeting these requirements. The Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Act mandates State plans for supporting plug-in hybrid electric vehicles and electric vehicle infrastructure, including interoperable charging infrastructure and minimum deployment requirements. State regulatory authorities and utilities must support electric utilities in meeting these requirements. The State regulatory authority and utilities must consider cost recovery for plans and implementation, including smart grid integration for plug-in hybrid electric vehicles and electric vehicles. The State regulatory authority and utilities must consider cost recovery for plans and implementation, including smart grid integration for plug-in hybrid electric vehicles and electric vehicles. This includes the ability for each vehicle to be individually identified and associated with its owner's electric utility account for billing and crediting purposes. Review of the determination made in response to the Energy Policy Act of 2005 should consider the use of time-of-use pricing. The curr_chunk discusses the implementation of time-of-use pricing for plug-in hybrid electric vehicles and electric vehicles to help meet peak-load power needs. It amends a section of the Public Utility Regulatory Policies Act of 1978 to require State regulatory authorities and utilities to consider this standard within a year of enactment. The curr_chunk amends the Public Utility Regulatory Policies Act of 1978 to require State regulatory authorities and utilities to consider time-of-use pricing for electric vehicles within two years of enactment. The curr_chunk amends Section 112(d) of the Public Utility Regulatory Policies Act of 1978 to include paragraph (20) before section 111(d).
